0.title: Couple on ventilator after Thane fire incident, their 7-yr-old son safe
0.article_body: Two residents of the 15-storey building in Thane, where a fire broke out on Saturday, have been reported to be on ventilator. They have been identified as 37-year-old Amol Kulkarni and his 33-year-old wife Vrushali Kulkarni. Reports said that their seven-year-old son is safe as he was not in the house when the fire broke out.

1.title: Again we faltered when it mattered: SA's Bavuma after defeat vs Netherlands
1.article_body: Speaking at the post-match ceremony after getting knocked out of the ongoing T20 World Cup following their defeat against Netherlands, South Africa captain Temba Bavuma said, "[It's a] hard one to swallow for the guys." He added, "We knew it was a must-win game and again we faltered when it mattered." Netherlands defeated South Africa by 13 runs.

2.title: 2 workers die after falling into sewage chamber of an MNC in Pune
2.article_body: Two workers died of suffocation while cleaning the sewage chamber of a multinational company in Pune. "[They] were working on [the] suction pipe after opening the cover of [the] chamber when one of them fell inside the tank. The other person also fell inside the chamber while rescuing the first one," said a police officer.

3.title: Woman run over by her own car 3 times after stopping on a slope in Switzerland
3.article_body: A 45-year-old woman was hospitalised after she was run over by her own car in Switzerland's St Gallen. Police said she was getting something out of the boot when her car, which was on a slight slope, struck her after rolling backwards. It ran over her two more times as it rebounded after hitting another vehicle and then a pavement.

4.title: Twitter to soon add ability to attach long-form text to tweets: Elon Musk
4.article_body: Elon Musk has tweeted that Twitter will soon add the ability to attach long-form text to tweets, "ending the absurdity of notepad screenshots." Replying to a Twitter user who asked if the feature would be like Twitter Notes, Musk said, "Something like that." Notably, in some countries, Twitter has launched the $8 monthly charge for its blue tick subscription service.

5.title: Counting of votes in by-polls to 7 Assembly seats in 6 states underway
5.article_body: Counting of votes is underway for by-polls to seven vacant Assembly seats across six states. Polling for the Assembly constituencies, which include Gopalganj and Mokama in Bihar, Adampur in Haryana, Andheri (East) in Maharashtra, Munugode in Telangana, Gola Gokrannath in Uttar Pradesh and Dhamnagar in Odisha, was held on November 3. Munugode had witnessed a voter turnout of over 93%.

6.title: Colaba-Bandra-SEEPZ metro barricades removal to start this month: MMRCL
6.article_body: The barricades put up on Mumbai roads since October 2016 for Colaba-Bandra-SEEPZ metro will be removed starting this month, Mumbai Metro Rail Corporation Limited's (MMRCL) MD Ashwini Bhide said. "Our attempt is to reinstate maximum roads before the 2023 monsoon. Only some sections would remain, where barricade withdrawal will happen by October, these would be towards South Mumbai," Bhide added.

7.title: Kohli's life is different from mine, he had MS Dhoni: Ahmad Shahzad
7.article_body: Talking about being compared to Virat Kohli in the past, Pakistan batter Ahmad Shahzad said, "[We can't be compared] because [our lives are]...different...He had MS Dhoni." "You can either have support from everyone or...[face a scenario where] everyone is trying to keep you out," added Shahzad. "Our senior players...can't digest seeing someone succeed," he had earlier stated.

8.title: Pankaj Tripathi's 'Criminal Justice' to be renewed for 4th season
8.article_body: Applause Entertainment's CEO Sameer Nair has confirmed the fourth season of 'Criminal Justice', which is headlined by Pankaj Tripathi. "Madhav Mishra (Pankaj's character) has become a character in his own right. So yes, now we are hard at work for putting together season 4," the producer confirmed. He added that the team has already started work on the show's script.

9.title: Cong means guarantee of corruption, selfish politics: PM in Himachal
9.article_body: Ahead of Himachal Pradesh polls, PM Narendra Modi on Saturday said Congress means the guarantee of "corruption and selfish politics". "During Congress' rule, there were various groups that had a vested interest in unstable governments," PM Modi said while addressing a rally in Solan. "BJP's work and resolve are strong while in Congress there's indecisiveness, uncertainty and anarchy," he added.

10.title: If you depend on Ashwin for batting, then what about your top 7: Gavaskar
10.article_body: Ex-India captain Sunil Gavaskar has criticised Team India management, questioning Ravichandran Ashwin's selection over Yuzvendra Chahal in India's playing XI in the ongoing T20 World Cup. "If you are going to depend on [Ashwin at] number eight [for batting], what does it tell you about your top 7 then?" asked Gavaskar. "India's batting has not quite...really clicked," he added.

11.title: TN to start NEET coaching for Class 11 & 12 from 3rd week of Nov
11.article_body: Tamil Nadu School Education Department has announced that it will start coaching classes for Class 11 and 12 for the National Eligibility cum Entrance Test (NEET) from the third week of November. Over 400 centres have been identified for providing the classes. The classes will be conducted in both Tamil and English and students can opt for either language.

12.title: You can't say Dinesh Karthik has flopped after 3 chances: Harbhajan
12.article_body: Harbhajan Singh said Dinesh Karthik should be backed as a finisher, adding that Karthik cannot be termed as a flop on the basis of "three chances". "There are other players who've failed...We don't talk about them...[as their stature is high]," stated Harbhajan. Karthik has scored 14 runs in four matches played so far by India in T20 World Cup 2022.

13.title: India qualify for semi-finals as Netherlands knock South Africa out of T20 World Cup 2022
13.article_body: India have qualified for T20 World Cup 2022 semi-finals after Netherlands defeated South Africa by 13 runs in a Super 12 stage match. Batting first, Netherlands put up a total of 158/4, with Colin Ackermann top-scoring with 41*(26). South Africa were restricted to 145/8. The winner of Pakistan-Bangladesh match will qualify for semi-finals, while South Africa have been knocked out.

14.title: Fraudster tells Maha man to invest in US company, cheats him of ₹59.8 lakh
14.article_body: A retired man in Navi Mumbai lost ₹59.8 lakh after a fraudster, who he met online, lured him into investing in a US-based company. The fraudster reportedly promised the victim seven times return on investment. The victim deposited the money in instalments into a bank account given to him. He later realised that he had been cheated of this money.

15.title: Twitter Blue roll out can be expected in less than a month in India: Elon Musk
15.article_body: Elon Musk has said Twitter Blue roll out can be expected within a month in India. A Twitter user asked, "When can we expect to have Twitter Blue roll out in India?" to which Musk replied, "Hopefully, less than a month." Twitter Blue with verification is currently available on iOS in the US, Canada, Australia, New Zealand and the UK.

16.title: Twitter begins rolling out $8 blue tick verification plan for iOS users in some countries
16.article_body: Twitter on Sunday began rolling out the $7.99 monthly charge for verified accounts, as announced by Elon Musk. Launched for Apple iOS users, the upgraded Twitter Blue includes benefits like "half the ads", the ability to post longer videos and priority ranking for quality content. The update is currently available in the US, Canada, Australia, New Zealand and the UK.

17.title: Delhi's air quality 'very poor' today with 363 AQI; Noida's AQI at 374
17.article_body: Delhi's overall air quality on Sunday morning was recorded in the 'very poor' category with an air quality index (AQI) of 363. The AQI in Noida also stood in the 'very poor' category at 374, while in Gurugram it stood at 384. The AQI in Delhi around the same time on Saturday was recorded at 431.

18.title: L&T Metro Rail, TSRTC sign agreement to ease travel in Hyderabad
18.article_body: The L&T Metro Rail (Hyderabad) Limited and Telangana State Road Transport Corporation (TSRTC) on Saturday signed a memorandum of understanding so as to ensure easier and more comfortable transportation facilities in Hyderabad. The agreement will also offer first and last-mile connectivity service in the city. TSRTC Managing Director VC Sajjanar said that the agreement is "historic".

19.title: Sri Lanka's Gunathilaka allegedly rapes 29-yr-old woman in Sydney amid T20 WC, arrested
19.article_body: Sri Lanka batter Danushka Gunathilaka has been arrested after being charged by police for allegedly raping a 29-year-old woman in Sydney amid the T20 World Cup 2022. As per police, he had met the victim after communicating with her via an online dating application. Gunathilaka was ruled out of T20 World Cup during the first round due to injury.

20.title: 34-year-old singer Aaron Carter found dead in bathtub at his home in US
20.article_body: Singer Aaron Carter, the younger brother of Backstreet Boys singer Nick Carter, was found dead in bathtub at his home in California on Saturday. Aaron gained recognition after opening for Backstreet Boys on their 1997 tour when he was just 10. The 34-year-old went public about being diagnosed with multiple personality disorder, schizophrenia, acute anxiety and manic depression in 2019.

21.title: Around 25 shops gutted in fire in Mumbai's Fashion Street, none injured
21.article_body: As many as 25 shops of clothes, footwear and accessories were completely gutted in fire in Mumbai's Fashion Street, located near Churchgate, after one of the shops caught fire on Saturday. However, no injuries were reported in the incident. As per locals, the blaze started due to a short circuit in one of the shops and quickly spread to others.

22.title: Twitter begins rolling out $8 blue tick verification service for iOS in some countries
22.article_body: Twitter on Saturday began rolling out $8 verification service which Elon Musk had announced. Twitter Blue with verification is currently available on iOS in the US, Canada, Australia, New Zealand and the UK. In an update on iPhones, Twitter said, "Blue checkmark: Power to people. Your account will get a blue checkmark, just like...celebrities, companies, and politicians you already follow."

23.title: 2,000 Mumbai stray dogs to get reflective collars to avoid night accidents
23.article_body: Online forum Planet for Plants and Animals (PPA), along with the students of Mithibai College, will be putting reflective collars on approximately 2,000 stray dogs to protect them from accidents at night. The drive would be launched at the Marine Drive today. It will be completed in a phased manner over a period of six weeks.

24.title: Free speech isn't a free pass, ensure human rights at Twitter: UN to Musk
24.article_body: The UN High Commissioner for Human Rights, Volker Türk, in an open letter to Elon Musk, stressed certain human rights principles and urged him to ensure human rights at Twitter. "Free speech is not a free pass," he wrote. He added that reports of Twitter firing its entire human rights team were not "an encouraging start".

25.title: Sukesh Chandrashekhar has become BJP's star campaigner: AAP leader
25.article_body: Ahead of Gujarat Assembly and Delhi MCD polls, AAP leader Saurabh Bharadwaj on Saturday said, "Big leaders of BJP have to use maha (biggest) thug like Sukesh Chandrashekhar...He has become a star campaigner of BJP." "The way BJP has panicked due to the...polls, it is visible in their nervousness," Bharadwaj added. Chandrashekhar is the main accused in an extortion case.

26.title: Players from Delhi belt have strength, boldness to perform: Dhawan on Kohli
26.article_body: Speaking about his teammate Virat Kohli, India's opening batter Shikhar Dhawan said that players from the Delhi belt have the strength and boldness to perform on the cricket field. Asked about Kohli's knock against Pakistan in the ongoing T20 World, Dhawan said that it was more important to follow the process instead of paying heed to the critics.

27.title: Asian Hockey Federation CEO Tayyab Ikram elected as new FIH Prez
27.article_body: Asian Hockey Federation CEO Mohammad Tayyab Ikram was elected as the new president of the International Hockey Federation (FIH) on Saturday. Ikram will succeed India's Narinder Batra as FIH's full-time chief. Ikram defeated Marc Coudron of Belgium 79-47 in the 48th FIH Congress. Notably, Ikram is a citizen of Macau but was born in Pakistan.

28.title: Senate Prez among 2 Haitian politicians sanctioned by US, Canada
28.article_body: The US and Canada on Friday imposed sanctions on two Haitian politicians, including the president of Haiti's Senate, as Washington accused them of indulging in drug trafficking and collaborating with gang networks. A US Treasury Department official said Youri Latortue and Haitian Senate President Joseph Lambert had "abused their official positions" to undermine the rule of law in Haiti.

29.title: Bihar will be among top 5 states in 2 yrs if given special status: Dy CM
29.article_body: Bihar will be counted among the top five states of India in just two years if it's granted special status by the Centre, Deputy CM Tejashwi Yadav said on Saturday. He claimed Bihar has been granted only ₹7.35 crore for the development of urban local bodies. He pointed out that Jharkhand, which is smaller than Bihar, is getting ₹12 crore.

30.title: 9 coaches of Nankana Sahib-bound train derail in Pakistan
30.article_body: A special train for Pakistani Sikh pilgrims to attend Guru Nanak's birth anniversary celebrations at Nankana Sahib in Punjab province derailed on Saturday. A Pakistan Railways spokesperson said nobody was injured in the incident. The official said nine bogies of the train, which was going from Karachi to Nankana Sahib, had derailed.

31.title: How often do you get chance to put Kohli in your pocket: Zimbabwe captain on India clash
31.article_body: Ahead of their T20 World Cup 2022 match against India on Saturday, Zimbabwe captain Craig Ervine said there's a great opportunity for his bowlers to bowl against some of the best batters in the world. "How often do you get the opportunity to put Virat Kohli in your pocket? I'm pretty sure...our pacers will be raring to go," he added.

32.title: Kohli is a champion player in all three formats: Ponting
32.article_body: Ex-Australian skipper Ricky Ponting said that Indian batter Virat Kohli is a "champion player of the game in all three formats for a long period of time". "India are now reaping the rewards of keeping him (Kohli) there...He's always been a really hard worker...I'm sure he'll produce something big in one of the finals as well," Ponting added.

33.title: Climate activists glue themselves to Goya paintings in Spain
33.article_body: Two climate activists on Saturday glued themselves to the frames of two paintings by prominent 18th-century Spanish painter Francisco Goya at the Prado Museum in Spain's Madrid, police said. Neither painting was damaged in the protest. The protesters drew "+1.5°C" on the wall between the two paintings, referring to the global temperature rise cap set by the 2015 Paris Agreement.

34.title: Chinese central bank's Dy Governor being probed for violations
34.article_body: A Deputy Governor in China's central bank is being investigated for alleged "serious violations of discipline and law", the ruling Communist Party's corruption agency said on Saturday. However, the details of the allegations against Fan Yifei have not been released. Fan joined the People's Bank of China in 2015 after a career in finance.

35.title: Focus on football, don't drag it into ideological battles: FIFA
35.article_body: Football governing body FIFA has urged the 32 teams preparing for the Qatar World Cup to focus on the game and avoid raising political issues. FIFA told federations to "not allow football to be dragged into every ideological or political battle that exists". Qatar as host sparked scrutiny on its treatment of low-paid migrant workers and laws criminalising same-sex relationships.

36.title: 'Full court commission' must probe Imran Khan’s allegations: Pak PM
36.article_body: Pakistan Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif said on Saturday that the Chief Justice of Pakistan must constitute a "full court commission" to investigate the allegations levelled by former PM Imran Khan. Khan, who was shot at in Wazirabad on November 3, has accused Prime Minister Sharif, Interior Minister Rana Sanaullah and Major General Faisal Naseer of orchestrating the assassination attempt.

37.title: 'F*** off' is a sexually coloured remark: Delhi court in sexual harassment case
37.article_body: Delhi's Tis Hazari court upheld a sexual harassment case against a man for saying "f*** off" to a woman and threatening her in 2019. Calling "f*** off" a "sexually coloured remark", the court said, "In Indian society...this word is not used to ask anyone to leave or go away." The man allegedly also called the woman a 'bazaru aurat'.

38.title: 'Ponniyin Selvan' makers donate ₹1 cr to Kalki Krishnamurthy Memorial Trust
38.article_body: Mani Ratnam's Madras Talkies and Lyca Productions, the makers of 'Ponniyin Selvan', have donated ₹1 crore to the Kalki Krishnamurthy Memorial Trust. A cheque was presented to the trust's Managing Trustee Seetha Ravi in the presence of Kalki Rajendran, son of 'Ponniyin Selvan' author Kalki Krishnamurthy. The trust helps underprivileged students with their education by giving them scholarships.

39.title: T20 more about older person's game: Ricky Ponting
39.article_body: Former Australian captain Ricky Ponting commented on the dynamics of cricket's T20 format. "I've also learned about the T20 game over the years that I've been involved, is it's more of an older man's game, or older person's game, than a young man's game," Ponting said. Notably, the 47-year-old former cricketer has won two ODI World Cups as a skipper.

40.title: Zaporizhzhia nuclear plant disconnected from Ukrainian power grid
40.article_body: The Zaporizhzhia Nuclear Power Plant, which is under Russian control, has been disconnected from Ukraine's power grid. The Zaporizhzhia nuclear plant is the largest in Europe. It has six power units and a capacity of 6,000 MW. Ukraine's nuclear power plant operator Energoatom's head said, Zaporizhzhia generated almost half of all the electricity produced by all nuclear plants in Ukraine.

41.title: I-League winner from this season onwards to be promoted to ISL: AIFF
41.article_body: The AIFF has announced that the winner of the I-League will play in the ISL next season, without paying any fee. The promotion of I-League winners of the 2022-23 season, as well as 2023-24, to the ISL, will be subject to fulfilling the club licensing criteria. "The decision is as per the roadmap which was agreed earlier," said AIFF.

42.title: Kyrgios settles case with Wimbledon fan he accused of being drunk
42.article_body: Australian tennis player Nick Kyrgios apologised to the fan he accused of being "drunk out of her mind" during his loss in this year's Wimbledon final. Kyrgios also donated £20,000 (₹18.65 lakh) to a charity of her choice after she filed a case against him. The fan stated that Kyrgios defamed her by making "a reckless and entirely baseless allegation".

43.title: India resumes sugar exports, allows 6 mn tonnes on quota basis till May 31
43.article_body: The government on Saturday allowed the export of six million tonnes of sugar on quota basis till May 31. The ministry has allocated a uniform export quota of 18.23% of the three years average production in operational sugar seasons. The government had restricted sugar exports towards the end of the 2021-22 season (October-September) to ensure sufficient stocks for domestic consumption.

44.title: England defender Ben Chilwell to miss Qatar WC due to hamstring injury
44.article_body: England defender Ben Chilwell will miss FIFA World Cup in Qatar after scans showed he had suffered significant damage to his hamstring. "Following my ACL injury, I worked so hard to make sure I was ready for the World Cup...Unfortunately, this won't be possible," said Chilwell. The Chelsea player was injured during the club's Champions League match against Dinamo Zagreb.

45.title: Prez of Ram Janmabhoomi trust hospitalised with urinary infection
45.article_body: Mahant Nritya Gopal Das, the President of Shri Ram Janmabhoomi Teerth Kshetra Trust, has been admitted to Medanta hospital in Uttar Pradesh following a urinary infection and general weakness. "He was brought from Ayodhya and admitted to the hospital on Friday," the hospital's Medical Director Rakesh Kapoor said. "On Saturday, his condition was stable and satisfactory," the doctor added.

46.title: Aakash praises Curran while joking about commentator's curse, he gets out next ball
46.article_body: Commentator Aakash Chopra praised England's Sam Curran while joking about commentator's curse with Harbhajan Singh, following which Curran got out in T20 World Cup match against Sri Lanka. Prior to the ball, Harbhajan asked Aakash, "Sometimes...batters we praise...they get out...How does this happen?" Aakash joked, "See...how good Curran is playing." Curran was dismissed on next ball for 6(11).

47.title: Indian Navy chief arrives in Japan ahead of Malabar Exercise
47.article_body: Indian Navy chief Admiral R Hari Kumar reached Japan on Saturday ahead of the beginning of this year's Malabar Exercise. Admiral Kumar and his Australian, Japanese and US counterparts exchanged views on further enhancing cooperation under the maritime exercise's framework, officials said. Admiral Kumar will be in Japan from November 5-9, during which he will attend the inauguration of Malabar-22.

48.title: Illegal house of 2 habitual criminals bulldozed in Ujjain
48.article_body: A two-storey illegal house of two habitual criminals in Madhya Pradesh's Ujjain was bulldozed by the administration on Saturday. The accused, Roshan Pasi and Sonu Pasi, recently attacked city security committee convenor Ashok Verma. When police started demolishing the house, a saint claimed the house in the name of an ashram and opposed the proceedings. However, police bulldozed the building.

49.title: What is the latest semi-final qualification scenario for India's T20 WC Super 12 group?
49.article_body: India and South Africa will qualify for semi-finals if they defeat Zimbabwe and Netherlands, respectively in their last T20 World Cup 2022 Super 12 Group 2 matches. In case Netherlands defeat South Africa, the winner of Bangladesh-Pakistan match will advance along with India. Pakistan and South Africa can qualify if they win their respective matches and India lose to Zimbabwe.

50.title: Earth's closest-ever black hole found, is 10 times the size of the Sun
50.article_body: Astronomers working at the International Gemini Observatory in the US have found a black hole, named Gaia BH1, that lies closest to the Earth. It is the first-ever detected dormant stellar-mass black hole of the Milky Way galaxy, scientists said, adding that its size is 10 times that of the Sun in our solar system. It's located 1600 light-years away.

51.title: Used to sell water cans, work in hotels: Kantara's Rishab on struggling days
51.article_body: 'Kantara' director-actor Rishab Shetty in a recent interview recalled how he used to do odd jobs like selling water cans and working in hotels to make ends meet during his days of struggle. "Whatever jobs I got, I did. [In] 2004, I started and in 2014...I got my first direction so in 10 years I had to survive," he added.

52.title: WHO Leprosy Goodwill Ambassador visits health centre in Ranchi
52.article_body: World Health Organization (WHO) Goodwill Ambassador for Leprosy Elimination Yohei Sasakawa on Saturday reviewed works undertaken in Jharkhand to eradicate leprosy, an official said. Yohei visited a primary health centre in Pithoria area of Ranchi and interacted with the workers there. "Leprosy is neither a curse of God nor a spreading disease. It can be cured completely," Yohei said.

53.title: Police seize drugs worth ₹5 cr in Assam's Guwahati, 2 arrested
53.article_body: Police on Saturday seized large quantities of drugs worth ₹5 crore from a vehicle and arrested two drug peddlers in connection with the case. The accused were identified as Rajib Miyan and Rekib Ahmed, hailing from Mankachar. "The vehicle was going from Guwahati to Mankachar...We've recovered 20,000 Yaba tablets in possession of two persons in the vehicle," police said.

54.title: Case against ex-PFI leader's family for smuggling SIM card into jail
54.article_body: Kerala Police has registered a case against the family of PFI's former Idukki District President TS Sainudeen for allegedly attempting to smuggle a SIM card hidden in the Quran into jail. The case against his wife, son Mohammed Yasin and Sainudeen's brother was registered under the Prison Act, said the police. The incident reportedly took place on November 1.

55.title: Nike suspends partnership with NBA star Kyrie over antisemitic tweet
55.article_body: Nike has suspended its relationship with NBA player Kyrie Irving after he tweeted a link to an antisemitic film last week. The shoemaker has cancelled its next Irving-branded shoe, the Kyrie 8. The shoe deal, reportedly worth $11 million a year, began in 2014. Irving apologised on Thursday after being suspended by Brooklyn Nets for at least five games.

56.title: It's just a phase: Rakul on being asked if 'Bollywood is dead'
56.article_body: Actress Rakul Preet Singh, when asked if she believes Bollywood is 'dead', said, "It's just a phase." She added people love to write about things that aren't working. Rakul further said that the audience's taste has changed after the pandemic and they want "larger-than-life cinema". Rakul was seen in 'Thank God', 'Dr. G', 'Cuttputli' and 'Runway 34' this year.

57.title: Power Grid Corporation's Q2 net profit rises over 8% YoY to ₹3,650 cr
57.article_body: Power Grid Corporation of India posted an 8.1% year-over-year growth in net profit to ₹3,650.16 crore during the July-September quarter against ₹3,376.38 crore from year-ago period. Its revenue rose 8.6% year-over-year to ₹11,150.57 crore. The board of directors approved payment of an interim dividend of ₹5/equity share of ₹10 each (at 50% of the paid-up equity share capital) for FY23.

58.title: 206 head constables and 419 constables promoted in J&K
58.article_body: Jammu and Kashmir Police has promoted 206 head constables and 419 constables, said a police spokesperson on Saturday. "On the recommendations of the Departmental Promotion Committee, ADGP (Additional Director General of Police) Kashmir, Vijay Kumar has approved the promotions," the spokesman said. The formal promotion orders of 156 head constables are pending a pre-promotion course, he added.

59.title: 5 lakh diyas lit in Varanasi's Gadauli Dham to mark 'Tulsi Vivah'
59.article_body: Around 5 lakh earthen lamps (diyas) were lit in Varanasi's Gadauli Dham on Saturday to mark the festival of 'Tulsi Vivah'. A video showing several people lighting diyas and clicking selfies at the site has surfaced online. The ceremonial wedding of goddess Tulsi signifies the end of the monsoon season and the beginning of the wedding season in Hinduism.

60.title: Newly discovered star system may be oldest in our galaxy: Scientists
60.article_body: Scientists have discovered a new star system that they believe could be the oldest in our galaxy. It consists of two white dwarf stars and the remains of rocky planets that are over 10 billion years old. As per researchers, the light of the two stars, located about 90 light-years from Earth, is changing colour due to rocky planets' remains.

61.title: Can't restrict a woman's right to reproductive choice: Kerala HC
61.article_body: No restriction can be placed on a woman's right to exercise her reproductive choice, the Kerala High Court (HC) said, as it allowed a 23-year-old MBA student to terminate her 26-week pregnancy. The observation was made by Justice VG Arun in an order on November 2. The woman was experiencing stress and the pregnancy may risk her life, he said.

62.title: Bridgerton 2's Charithra visits Thanjavur temple, eats on banana leaf; shares pics
62.article_body: Charithra Chandran, the British actress who starred in 'Bridgerton season 2', took to Instagram to share pictures from her visit to her native place in Tamil Nadu. She visited Airavatesvara Temple located in Kumbakonam, Thanjavur. A picture shared by Charithra showed food being served on a banana leaf in a restaurant. Reacting to her post, a fan wrote, "Love this."

63.title: Punjab could see return to the dark era of 1980s: Ex-CM Amarinder
63.article_body: Ex-Punjab CM Amarinder Singh said "the way things are unfolding in the state", it could see the return of the dark era of the 1980s. He condemned the "complete failure" of the AAP government in taking action even 24 hours after Shiv Sena (Taksali) leader Sudhir Suri's murder. He added that gangsters were "having a free run" in the state.

64.title: Cong promises free power, ₹1,500 per month for women in Himachal poll manifesto
64.article_body: The Congress on Saturday released its manifesto for the Himachal Pradesh Assembly elections in the presence of Chhattisgarh CM Bhupesh Baghel. If elected to power, the party has promised ₹1,500 per month to women, 300 units of free electricity and the purchase of cow dung at ₹2 per kg. Congress has also promised to implement the old pension scheme.

65.title: Iran's Revolutionary Guards test satellite carrier: State media
65.article_body: Iran's Revolutionary Guards test-launched a solid-fueled satellite carrier called the Ghaem-100 on Saturday, Iranian state media reported. The rocket would be able to put a satellite weighing 80 kg into orbit some 500 kilometres from Earth, state media said. The West has long been suspicious of Iran's space program as the same technology can be used to develop long-range missiles.

66.title: Rain kills 3 people in Tamil Nadu, season toll rises to 26
66.article_body: Three more people have died in rain-related incidents in Tamil Nadu, taking the total number of deaths due to rains in the state this season to 26, said officials on Saturday. CM MK Stalin has ordered a solatium of ₹4 lakh for the families of each deceased person. Tamil Nadu received 10.04 mm of rain in the last 24 hours.

67.title: Congress poll promises won’t be taken seriously in Himachal: Thakur
67.article_body: Union Minister Anurag Thakur criticised Congress over its poll promises made in Himachal Pradesh, claiming no one will take them seriously as the party itself has "no guarantee". Thakur said various promises made by Congress in the past have remained unfulfilled. He added that farmers in Punjab voted out Congress for failing to fulfil its loan waiver promise.

68.title: Unexploded mortar shell defused near LoC in J&K's Poonch district
68.article_body: A live mortar shell was defused at a village in the forward area along the LoC in J&K's Poonch district on Saturday, officials informed. A bomb disposal squad was rushed to the village when authorities received information about the unexploded ordnance, as per officials. It apparently landed in the village during cross-border shelling by Pakistan some years ago, officials said.

69.title: Pray for return of Kailash Mansarovar & PoK to India: RSS leader
69.article_body: RSS leader Indresh Kumar asked Indians to offer special prayers every morning for the return of Kailash Mansarovar and PoK from the "illegal occupation" of China and Pakistan. "The common man in India is of the opinion that India is incomplete without Karachi, Nankana Sahib and Sharada Peeth," he added. He also called for having faith in PM Modi's policies.

70.title: Fan from Goa would send me vials of blood, obscene pics via courier: Raveena Tandon
70.article_body: Actress Raveena Tandon, while recalling a fan stalking incident, said that a fan from Goa was convinced that he was married to her. "He'd send me vials of blood through courier, he'd send letters written in blood and obscene photographs," she added. She further said, "It was really crazy and scary."

71.title: 600 disabled persons in Fiji to get artificial limbs via Jaipur Foot
71.article_body: The Ministry of External Affairs of India, as part of its 'India for Humanity' programme, will provide artificial limbs to 600 disabled people through NGO Jaipur Foot in Fiji. Fijian PM Frank Bainimarama inaugurated the Jaipur Foot Artificial Limb Fitment Camp at a hospital in Suva. "A professionally fitted prosthetic can boost feelings of self-esteem, self-worth and dignity," Bainimarama said.

72.title: Opposition 'unnecessarily' spreading the fear of dengue: UP Dy CM
72.article_body: Uttar Pradesh Deputy CM Brajesh Pathak on Saturday accused the opposition of "unnecessarily" spreading the fear of dengue among the people and said the situation was under control. "Ministers are moving in districts and monitoring the arrangements for prevention of dengue," Pathak said. His comment comes after Samajwadi Party claimed the state government was misleading people on dengue cases.

73.title: Planning state's first lion safari in north Bengal: Forest Minister
73.article_body: According to West Bengal Forest Minister Jyotipriya Mallick, the forest department is planning to come up with the state's first lion safari in north Bengal. "We already have a tiger safari in north Bengal," Mallick said. "We're going to approach the Central Zoo Authority for the permission by the end of this month," an official of state zoo authority said.

74.title: Congress will fight against attempts to divide WB: Adhir Chowdhury
74.article_body: Congress leader Adhir Ranjan Chowdhury on Saturday said that his party will never allow the division of West Bengal. "Elections are coming, so BJP is raking up such issues. Congress will always fight against any attempt to divide West Bengal," Chowdhury said. "If...people of northern West Bengal feel neglected, it's the responsibility of...state government to address it," he added.

75.title: Who takes Cong seriously? It'll win less than 5 seats in Guj: Kejriwal
75.article_body: While speaking at a media conclave on Saturday, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal questioned, "Who takes the Congress seriously?" Ahead of the Gujarat Assembly elections, the Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) leader also predicted that the Congress will win less than five seats in the state. Kejriwal further claimed that his party will get 30% vote share in the elections.

76.title: I realise many are angry with me, I apologise: Twitter Co-founder as Musk orders layoffs
76.article_body: As Twitter laid off 50% of its employees company-wide after Elon Musk acquired it, its Co-founder and former CEO Jack Dorsey said, "I realize many are angry with me." He added, "I own the responsibility for why everyone is in this situation: I grew the company size too quickly. I apologise for that." He called Twitter employees "strong and resilient".

77.title: Wood is very intelligent bowler, offers a lot more than just pace: Farokh
77.article_body: Ex-Indian cricketer Farokh Engineer said that English pacer Mark Wood is a very intelligent bowler. "Wood won't change his approach; he will keep on bowling quicker and as quick as he can. He will use the bouncer effectively," Engineer said. He added, "The thing is that all English players play professional cricket, so they are more professional than Sri Lankans."

78.title: 2 DRG jawans killed in a road accident in Chhattisgarh's Sukma
78.article_body: Two jawans of the District Reserve Group (DRG) died on Saturday after their two-wheeler collided head-on with a trailer in Chhattisgarh's Sukma district. "The two DRG jawans met with a road accident along Sukma-Kerlapal National Highway and succumbed to injuries," Bastar IG Sundarraj P said. The deceased were identified as Padam Muya and Mausam Subba.

79.title: 50 students fall sick after eating poha at govt school in Telangana
79.article_body: Over 50 students at a government school fell ill due to food poisoning and were admitted to a hospital in Telangana's Sangareddy, Narayankhed Revenue Divisional Officer Ambadas Rajeshwar said. According to him, the students had consumed poha as breakfast in the morning, following which a few of them found worms in the food. "The students are...out of danger," Rajeshwar added.

80.title: Berkshire Hathaway posts $2.68 bn loss in Q3, operating profit rises 20%
80.article_body: Warren Buffet's Berkshire Hathaway posted a net loss of $2.68 billion in the third quarter, against a $10.34 billion gain a year before. In the second quarter of this year, Berkshire reported a $43.8 billion loss. Berkshire Hathaway's operating profit rose 20% in the third quarter to $7.76 billion after taxes, beating analysts' estimates.

81.title: 'Fabulous Lives of Bollywood Wives' is not scripted: Neelam Kothari
81.article_body: Actress Neelam Kothari has said her web show, 'The Fabulous Lives of Bollywood Wives', is not scripted. "They tell us we'll be shooting at such and such venue but what we discuss is up to us. We decide to fight and cry, it depends on us," she added. The show also features Bhavana Pandey, Seema Sajdeh and Maheep Kapoor.

82.title: SRK calls Akshay a 'wonderful friend', says Salman is 'awesome & very kind'
82.article_body: Shah Rukh Khan conducted an #AskSRK session on Twitter during which he spoke about his equation with Akshay Kumar and Salman Khan. When a fan asked him to describe Salman in one word, he said, "Awesome and very kind (sorry two words)...but bhai hai na." After a user wrote, "Say something about...Akshay," he replied, "He's been...wonderful friend for years now."

83.title: Which sportspersons have been recommended for Arjuna Award as no cricketer included?
83.article_body: A total of 25 names have been reportedly recommended for this year's Arjuna Award, including badminton player Lakshya Sen, boxer Nikhat Zareen and chess Grandmaster R Praggnanandhaa. No cricketer has reportedly been recommended for the award. Other athletes include Avinash Sable, Vikas Thakur, HS Prannoy, Eldhose Paul, Anshu Malik and Sreeja Akula, among others.

84.title: Who is 16-year-old Ankith who'll represent India at UN climate change summit?
84.article_body: A 16-year-old boy from Hyderabad has been chosen to speak at the 2022 United Nations Climate Change Conference (COP27), which begins on Sunday in Egypt. Ankith Suhas Rao is the head boy of Hyderabad Public School and has been associated with his school's COP group. At COP27, he will present a paper on the kids' learnings on climate change.

85.title: Kohli ate everything, became quite fat and changed all of that with will power: Dhawan
85.article_body: Talking about Virat Kohli, who is celebrating his 34th birthday today, Shikhar Dhawan said that Kohli's self belief is very strong. He added, "He is quite disciplined as well, he ate everything and became quite fat and he changed all of that with his will power." He further said that Kohli's mindset is "very positive".

86.title: Dalits treated like slaves for past 75 years: Ex-Bihar CM Manjhi
86.article_body: Former Bihar CM Jitan Ram Manjhi said Dalits have been treated like "slaves" and untouchables by Hindus for the "past 75 years". "Priests are reluctant to perform ceremonies...and even when they do, they do not agree to accept food offered by you," said Manjhi. The BJP, in response, asked Manjhi to "come clean" on his "religious identity".

87.title: Climate activists block private jet take-offs at Amsterdam airport
87.article_body: More than 100 climate activists on Saturday stormed into an area where private jets are parked at Amsterdam's Schiphol Airport and prevented several planes from departing by sitting in front of their wheels. The protest was part of demonstrations in and around the airport against greenhouse gas emissions and other pollution caused by the airport and aviation industry.

88.title: 100-yr-old building collapses after heavy rains in Chennai; 2 dead
88.article_body: A 100-year-old building on NSC Bose road in Chennai, which was identified as unsafe by the Greater Chennai Corporation in 2014, collapsed on Friday following heavy rains. Kangudevi (60) and Sankar (36) died in the incident. Two other people were hospitalised with minor injuries. Fire service and police officials were rushed to the spot to carry out a rescue operation.

89.title: State needs a BJP govt that would provide stability: PM Modi in Himachal
89.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Saturday criticised the Congress and said that Himachal Pradesh needs a government that would provide stability. Addressing an election rally in Solan, PM Modi said, "During Congress' rule, there were various groups that had...vested interest in unstable governments." "You need not remember the BJP candidate, only remember the symbol of 'Lotus'," PM Modi added.

90.title: PM handing out few thousand jobs while millions unemployed: Kharge
90.article_body: Congress President Mallikarjun Kharge said PM Narendra Modi is handing over some thousand appointment letters when "millions of youth search for jobs". "Our youth is forced to wait for years...All this is because of lack of will and false promises," he said. Kharge added that it took the Centre 10 years to 'even think' of filling existing central government vacancies.

91.title: NIA files charges against Dawood, 4 aides in terror funding case
91.article_body: The National Investigation Agency (NIA) on Saturday filed charges against gangster Dawood Ibrahim, his close aide Chhota Shakeel and three other associates for allegedly arranging funds for terror activities. The accused had allegedly raised, collected and extorted money by threatening individuals. The funds collected were meant for the benefit of "an individual terrorist", the NIA stated.

92.title: People will say 'jai Ram ji ki' to Jairam Thakur in Himachal: Baghel
92.article_body: Chhattisgarh CM Bhupesh Baghel on Saturday said that people of Himachal Pradesh will say "jai Ram ji ki" (bid farewell) to Jairam Thakur-led BJP government in the state. "[BJP has] created a hole in people's pockets by increasing the prices of petrol...and cooking gas," the Congress leader added. He claimed the Congress is taking issues like inflation and unemployment seriously.

93.title: 75-yr-old man mauled to death by tiger in Maha: Forest official
93.article_body: A 75-year-old man was mauled to death by a tiger in the forest of Chandrapur district in Maharashtra, a forest official informed. Jagan Panse, a resident of Lakhapur village, had gone into the forest to collect firewood on Friday but did not return home, the official said. Panse's body was found in the forest on Saturday morning, the official added.

94.title: Rahane-led Mumbai defeat Himachal to win Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy for 1st time ever
94.article_body: Ajinkya Rahane-led Mumbai defeated Himachal Pradesh by three wickets to win Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy (SMAT) for the first time ever. Batting first, Himachal Pradesh posted a total of 143/8, with Ekant Sen top-scoring with 37(29). Mumbai chased down the target in 19.3 overs, with Sarfaraz Khan scoring 36*(31). Both Himachal and Mumbai were featuring in their first SMAT final.

95.title: Cong means guarantee of corruption, selfish politics: PM in Himachal
95.article_body: PM Narendra Modi, while addressing an election rally in Himachal Pradesh's Solan on Saturday, said, "Congress means guarantee of corruption and selfish politics." "During Congress rule, there were various groups that had a vested interest in unstable governments. Small states were the target of such self-centred groups," he added. "These groups worked only for their own interests," the PM said.

96.title: It was an amazing fight, we could have done better: Dasun after loss to Eng
96.article_body: After losing to England on Saturday, Sri Lankan skipper Dasun Shanaka said that it was an "amazing fight". "We could have done better. I think the wicket played a part in this game...It was the powerplay where we didn't bowl well, they (England) played well," Shanaka said. He added, "Catching has been a problem...we need to go back and improve."

97.title: Pakistan secures $13 bn in financial aid from China & Saudi Arabia: Report
97.article_body: Pakistan has secured $9 billion from China and $4 billion from Saudi Arabia in financial aid on top of assurances for about $20 billion in investments, the Dawn newspaper reported. During Pakistan Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif's recent Beijing visit, China also agreed to fast-track the processing for a $9.8 billion high-speed rail project from Karachi to Peshawar, the report added.

98.title: 'Jana Gana Mana' & 'Vande Mataram' must be given the same level of respect: Govt
98.article_body: The national anthem of India ('Jana Gana Mana') and the national song ('Vande Mataram') have equal status, the Centre has told Delhi High Court. Every Indian citizen must show the same level of respect to both songs, the Ministry of Home Affairs said. 'Vande Mataram' has a "unique and special place in the emotions...of the people of India," it added.

99.title: PM Modi visits Radha Soami Satsang Beas dera, meets Baba Dhillon
99.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Saturday visited Radha Soami Satsang Beas dera in Punjab and met its chief Baba Gurinder Singh Dhillon. The PM also went to the community kitchen where women followers were preparing food. Earlier, he hailed the community service efforts undertaken by the organisation. The dera has followers in several states, including Punjab, Himachal Pradesh and Rajasthan.

100.title: These situations are built for Stokes: Buttler after win over Sri Lanka
100.article_body: After winning against Sri Lanka, England skipper Jos Buttler said that these situations are made for all-rounder Ben Stokes who scored a match-winning 42*(36) on Saturday. "He (Stokes) can play a lot of roles for us in this T20 setup...[Sri Lanka] got off to a really good start...But the way Adil Rashid got us back was wonderful," Buttler said.

101.title: Dover immigration centre attack was a terrorist incident: UK police
101.article_body: British police on Saturday said evidence showed the petrol bomb attack on the Dover immigration facility last week was a terrorist incident motivated by an extreme right-wing ideology. "There's currently nothing to suggest the offender was working alongside anyone else," police added. There are strong indications that the suspect's mental health was also a factor in the attack, police said.

102.title: Will never happen: SRK to fan asking about Kardashian-like show on his family
102.article_body: Actor Shah Rukh Khan, during an #AskSRK session on Twitter, replied to a fan who asked, "If you and your family had a TV show like the Kardashians, what would it be called?" The actor responded, "It will never happen we are a very private family...but Khandaan I guess??!" On the work front, Shah Rukh will be seen in 'Pathaan'.

103.title: Postpone rear seat belt rule till Dec 31: Mumbai Taxi Union to police
103.article_body: The Mumbai Taxi Union has written to the Joint Commissioner of Police (Traffic) requesting him to postpone the implementation of the rear passenger seat belt to December 31. The Union said many operators had removed the rear seat belt and there was a delay in availability. The Union also welcomed the decision to impose fines on passengers and not drivers.

104.title: Varun breaks down remembering late driver, says 'I'm still dealing with it'
104.article_body: Actor Varun Dhawan broke down in tears while remembering his late driver Manoj Sahu at a recent event. Manoj, who had been with him for 26 years, passed away after suffering a heart attack earlier this year. Talking about his demise, Varun said, "It's taken me...long time to find...courage to talk about this. But, honestly, I'm still dealing with it."

105.title: Delhi's pupil-teacher ratio for upper primary worst in India: Report
105.article_body: Delhi has the poorest student-teacher ratio in the upper primary school level (classes VI to VIII) in the country for 2021-22, the Unified District Information System for Education Plus said. The ratio of teacher-pupil in the upper primary level in Delhi is 33:1. In the primary level (classes I to V), Delhi has the second poorest student-teacher ratio after Bihar.

106.title: TN man picking his daughter assaulted by youths outside college
106.article_body: A video showing some youths allegedly assaulting a 50-year-old man who had come to pick up his daughter from Sri Meenakshi Government Arts College for Women in Tamil Nadu's Madurai has surfaced online. Police said a funeral procession was passing near the college entrance when the students were exiting the college. Six people have been arrested so far, police added.

107.title: Heavy rainfall, thunderstorm warning issued for several states for next few days
107.article_body: As per IMD, heavy rainfall is very likely over Kerala, Tamil Nadu, Puducherry and Jammu & Kashmir on Sunday. It is very likely over Andaman and Nicobar Islands from November 6 to 8. Thunderstorm accompanied with lightning is very likely over Tamil Nadu on Sunday. It is very likely over Kerala and Puducherry from November 6 to 9.

108.title: Everything was so public, I felt haunted: Selena on breakup with Justin Bieber
108.article_body: Singer Selena Gomez opened up about her breakup with Justin Bieber and said, "Everything was so public. I felt haunted by a past relationship that no one wanted to let go of." "I feel like I'd to go through the worst possible heartbreak ever," she added. Selena and Justin broke up in 2018 after an on-off relationship of eight years.

109.title: Mumbai Congress leader booked for cheating jeweller of ₹17.5 lakh
109.article_body: A Congress leader has been booked by Mumbai Police for allegedly cheating a jeweller of ₹17.5 lakh. Mumbai Congress General Secretary Mohan Singh Saini allegedly took the money promising high returns but used it to fund his son's studies. Saini claims the money was to fund the studies but the complainant demanded exorbitant interest when he tried to return it.

110.title: Make field visits, step up surveillance: UP CM to officials amid dengue cases
110.article_body: Amid the rising dengue cases in Uttar Pradesh, CM Yogi Adityanath on Saturday held a meeting with state health department officials and directed nodal officers to make field visits. He also instructed them to step up surveillance in the affected areas. "All municipal corporations and local bodies...should conduct special campaigns on cleanliness, fogging and anti-larva spray," he added.

111.title: Christian monastery pre-dating Islam discovered on UAE island
111.article_body: An ancient Christian monastery possibly dating back to the period preceding the emergence of Islam in the Arabian Peninsula has been discovered in the UAE, officials announced on Thursday. The monastery has been discovered on Siniyah Island of Umm Al Quwain emirate. Carbon dating indicates the samples found in the monastery's foundation date as far back as 534 AD.

112.title: 60,000 Yaba tablets worth ₹15 crore seized from Manipur man in Assam
112.article_body: Assam Police on Saturday arrested a Manipur-based man from the Sonapur area of Kamrup Metropolitan district for allegedly transporting over 60,000 Yaba tablets worth ₹15 crore, an official said. According to police, the tablets were seized from a four-wheeler vehicle coming from the Meghalaya side. "Commendable feat," Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma wrote while sharing the information on Twitter.

113.title: Not great: Mark Wood on attack on ex-Pakistan PM Imran Khan
113.article_body: England's Mark Wood said that the attack on ex-Pakistan PM Imran Khan is "not great". "He's an ex-cricketer, so it's close to home for us," Wood said. He added, "We were looked after really well (during the tour to Pakistan in September-October 2022) but I'd be lying if I said I wasn't worried by that because you're going back there."

114.title: Password attacks rise to 921 every second globally: Microsoft
114.article_body: According to Microsoft's 'Digital Defense Report 2022', the volume of password attacks has risen to an estimated 921 attacks every second globally, a 74% increase in just one year. The report added Microsoft removed over 10,000 domains used by cybercriminals. From July 2021 to June 2022, Microsoft's digital defence teams blocked 34.7 billion identity threats and 37 billion email threats.

115.title: Producer alleges SRK's Jawan's story is copied from a Tamil film, files complaint
115.article_body: Producer Manickam Narayanan has alleged that Shah Rukh Khan's upcoming film Jawan's story has been copied from Tamil film 'Perarasu'. Manickam has filed a complaint with the Tamil Film Producers Council (TFPC), accusing Jawan makers of plagiarism. TFPC board members will be investigating the complaint filed by Manickam after November 7, reports said.

116.title: I have told people to not call me a legend or veteran: Anupam Kher
116.article_body: Actor Anupam Kher said that he does not carry the burden of being a senior actor as doing so makes his life and job easy. "I have told people to not call me a legend or veteran, or uncle for that matter," Anupam said. "I don't allow that because these are the clichés decided by society," he added.

117.title: IT dept raids offices of former MLA Zulfikar Ahmed Bhutto in UP, other states
117.article_body: The Income Tax (IT) department on Saturday conducted raids at the house, offices and factory of former BSP MLA and meat exporter Zulfikar Ahmed Bhutto. The raids were carried out in Uttar Pradesh, Delhi, Chandigarh (Punjab), Jaipur (Rajasthan), Aurangabad (Maharashtra), and Nuh (Haryana). They also searched the AOV Slaughter House of HMA Group in Unnao.

118.title: Tower D of Gurugram’s Chintels Paradiso Society to be demolished
118.article_body: Tower D of Gurugram's Chintels Paradiso Society will be demolished as per the recommendations of a report by IIT, Delhi, said Gurugram Deputy Commissioner Nishant Kumar Yadav on Saturday. A structural audit of the tower was conducted after a portion of an apartment collapsed in February this year, killing two women. The tower has over 50 flats.

119.title: 36th edition of Pune International Marathon to be held on December 4
119.article_body: The 36th edition of the Pune International Marathon will be held on December 4. The run will start at midnight and end at 9 am. "The night timing helps us to conduct a smooth race and we can avoid traffic chaos," said the President of Pune International Marathon Trust. The men's and women's full marathon will be 42.195 km long.

120.title: BJP MP Rita found guilty of model code violation during 2012 UP polls
120.article_body: A special court on Friday found BJP MP Rita Bahuguna Joshi and four others guilty of violating the Model Code of Conduct during the 2012 Uttar Pradesh Assembly elections. Rita, who was a Congress leader in 2012, had allegedly addressed a rally after the campaigning period had ended. The court asked the convicts to file two sureties of ₹20,000 each.

121.title: US Treasury Secy Yellen to visit India on Nov 11 for economic meet
121.article_body: US Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen will visit New Delhi on November 11 to participate in the 9th India-US Economic and Financial Partnership dialogue. "Secretary Yellen will highlight the strength of the US' partnership with India, which continues to deepen," US Treasury Department said. She will hold a bilateral meeting with Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman to discuss India's G20 presidency.

122.title: 6 people, including madrassa students, drown in lake in Telangana
122.article_body: Five madrassa students and their teacher drowned in a lake in Telangana's Medchal-Malkajgiri district. According to the officials of the Jawaharnagar Police Station, the students entered the lake to swim and could not come out after which their teacher also entered the lake. The deceased had come to the Malkaram area to attend a function, police said.

123.title: Family demands martyr status for slain Shiv Sena leader Sudhir Suri
123.article_body: The family of Shiv Sena leader Sudhir Suri, who was shot dead in Amritsar on Friday, has demanded martyr status for him. His son Manik Suri said, "We're demanding status of martyr for my father, suspension of negligent officers & security and another accommodation for us." "Won't cremate him until our demands are met," he added.

124.title: Hyderabad is water sufficient for next 40 years: Water board MD
124.article_body: The Managing Director of Hyderabad Metropolitan Water Supply and Sewerage Board (HMWSSB), Dana Kishore, said that Hyderabad is water sufficient for the next 40 years. Addressing the Telangana Infra Summit 2022 on the theme 'Physical infrastructure and realty prospects and challenges', Kishore cited an Oxford Cities report and said that by 2030, Hyderabad may have a GDP of $85 billion.

125.title: I check for hidden cameras in my hotel rooms, I'm extremely cautious: Dia
125.article_body: Actress Dia Mirza opened up about the security measures she takes before checking into a hotel room. "A thorough check for hidden cams, getting the hotel to assign a room after arrival, keeping the room number private etc," she said. Dia further said she became "extremely cautious" after "videos of actresses bathing surfaced on the net about a decade ago".

126.title: Delhi LG 'misusing powers', he should fight MCD polls: AAP leader
126.article_body: AAP leader Durgesh Pathak on Saturday criticised Delhi Lieutenant Governor VK Saxena and  accused him of "misusing his powers". "Since there's a change in Municipal Corporation of Delhi (MCD) and there are 250 wards now...We want LG VK Saxena to fight the upcoming municipal elections in Delhi," Pathak said. "Let's see whether the citizens support him or not," he added.

127.title: Saw exorbitant amount of money reaching AAP Gujarat office: Ex-AAP leader
127.article_body: After rejoining Congress, former AAP leader Indranil Rajguru said that he saw an exorbitant amount of money reaching the latter's Gujarat state office. "[AAP's] CM face was pre-decided and I was told not to insist and that [MLA] list comes from Kamalam (Gujarat BJP headquarters)...It's a party that befools people. So, I returned to Congress," Rajguru said.

128.title: BMC to concretise, revamp road leading to Maha Dy CM Fadnavis' home
128.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) has undertaken concretisation and beautification work of roads near Maharashtra Deputy CM Devendra Fadnavis' residence. The total cost of the tender is ₹22.27 crore and the roads which are going to be concretised are Narayan Dabholkar road and J Mehta road. An advanced drainage system and utility ducts will also be constructed, an official said.

129.title: Ind cricket was lacking fitness, fielding side of things before Kohli: Deep
129.article_body: Ex-cricketer Deep Dasgupta said that Indian cricket was lacking in the fitness and fielding side of things before Virat Kohli's impact. "Kohli's impact on Indian cricket is humongous," Dasgupta said. He added, "Kohli looks at himself as an athlete as cricket demands a different fitness skill set...I am so glad that he has got his mojo back."

130.title: NIA arrests 3 PFI workers in Praveen Nettaru murder case
130.article_body: The NIA on Saturday arrested three Popular Front of India (PFI) workers from Bengaluru and Dakshina Kannada district in connection with the killing of BJP Yuva Morcha member Praveen Nettaru. The agency carried out raids at five locations in Dakshina Kannada, Hubballi and Mysuru. Digital devices and incriminating documents were allegedly seized from the houses of the accused.

131.title: BJP offered to drop charges against Jain, Sisodia if we left Guj polls: Kejriwal
131.article_body: AAP chief Arvind Kejriwal has claimed that the BJP offered to dissolve cases against AAP ministers if the party quit the Gujarat Assembly elections. "After Manish Sisodia rejected their offer to be Delhi Chief Minister by leaving AAP, they've approached me now," Kejriwal said. "They've said if you leave Gujarat...we'll spare...Satyendar Jain and Sisodia," he added.

132.title: Case filed against Dr Anahita who drove car that crashed, killing Cyrus Mistry
132.article_body: Dr Anahita Pandole, who was driving the car in which former Tata Sons Chairman Cyrus Mistry was travelling during his accident in September, has been booked by police in Maharashtra. Pandole is still in the ICU and is undergoing treatment due to injuries from the accident. Police recorded her husband Darius Pandole's statement. Mistry was killed in the accident.

133.title: ‘Holy mud’ to be used for unveiling of Kempegowda statue in B'luru
133.article_body: A team of four ministers of the Karnataka government visited three historical places in the state to collect the holy mud to be used during the unveiling of the Kempegowda statue. The soil has been collected from Hampi, Kudalasangama and Kitturu. The 108 feet bronze statue at Bengaluru Airport will be unveiled by Prime Minister Narendra Modi on November 11.

134.title: 19-year-old college student run over by speeding crane dies in B'luru
134.article_body: A 19-year-old college student died at a hospital on Friday, two days after being run over by a mobile crane which was allegedly being driven at high speed in Bengaluru's Whitefield. A CCTV footage showed Noor Fatima, a first-year BCom student, walking on the road before the vehicle hit her. The driver of the crane, Periya Swamy, has been arrested.

135.title: Bank of Baroda posts 59% YoY rise in Q2 net profit to ₹3,313 crore
135.article_body: Bank of Baroda reported a 58.7% year-over-year increase in net profit for the July-September quarter to ₹3,313.42 crore from the previous fiscal's ₹2,087.85 crore. The public sector lender's net interest income surged 34.5% to ₹10,174.46 crore during the second quarter. The bank's gross non-performing assets (NPAs) dropped 22.06% to ₹46,374.4 crore from last September's ₹59,503.82 crore.

136.title: Actor Govinda bumps into his lookalike at Mumbai airport, video surfaces
136.article_body: A video has surfaced online showing actor Govinda bumping into his lookalike, who was dressed in a maroon suit and wore sunglasses, at the Mumbai airport. In the video, the lookalike can be seen presenting a bouquet to Govinda and posing with him for the paparazzi. "Who is the real Govinda?" a fan joked. "Same to same," wrote another.

137.title: Virat Kohli cuts birthday cake with Indian journalists at MCG, video goes viral
137.article_body: Indian journalists covering the T20 World Cup 2022 surprised Virat Kohli with a cake at the Melbourne Cricket Ground (MCG) on the occasion of his 34th birthday. "Very nice gesture. This is a historic venue and all the media people are here, so it's a very nice gesture," Kohli said. The journalists also presented Kohli with a greeting card.

138.title: Notices sent to 20 rooftop restaurants in Pune for violating norms
138.article_body: Notices have been sent to 20 rooftop restaurants in Pune for violating norms between November 1 and 4, officials said. "We will be taking strict action against illegal rooftop restaurants...Engineers...are personally visiting these restaurants and issuing notices," said a Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) official. This came after a fire broke out in Lulla Nagar on November 1.

139.title: Musk bought outfit that spews lies across the world: US Prez on Twitter deal
139.article_body: US President Joe Biden on Friday reacted to the world's richest man Elon Musk's Twitter acquisition deal, saying the latter bought "an outfit that...spews lies all across the world". "There are no editors anymore in America...How do we expect kids to be able to understand what is at stake?" Biden added. Musk has called himself a "free speech absolutist".

140.title: When I turn producer, I will tell actors to slash their prices: Rajkummar
140.article_body: Rajkummar Rao, when asked if actors should reduce their prices if their films don't work well, said, "I can't tell others to slash rates...This is the call that...producers will have to take." He added he will ask actors to slash their prices "a bit" when he will become a producer. Rajkummar further said he doesn't charge much for his projects.

141.title: How does the final T20 World Cup 2022 Super 12 Group 1 points table read?
141.article_body: New Zealand, England and Australia accumulated seven points each in Group 1 of T20 World Cup 2022's Super 12 stage. New Zealand and England advanced to the semi-finals with a net run-rate of +2.113 and +0.473, respectively. Afghanistan finished last on the table with three losses in five matches. Ireland won just one match, while Sri Lanka won two matches.

142.title: I got my first salary at the age of 13: Jaya Bachchan
142.article_body: Veteran actress Jaya Bachchan, in an episode of her granddaughter Navya Naveli Nanda's podcast, revealed that she got her first salary at the age of 13. "I don't even know how much I was paid," she added. Jaya further said when she went to study, she paid for her education as she did not want her father to finance her.

143.title: Sharad Pawar flies to Shirdi from Mumbai with doctors to attend NCP meet
143.article_body: NCP President Sharad Pawar flew to Shirdi today with a team of doctors to attend a party meet. He has been undergoing treatment at the Breach Candy hospital in Mumbai. "I am sure the situation will change...Party cadres wished that I come for the meeting where discussions on the ideology...and policies of the NCP are being discussed," said Pawar.

144.title: You forced me to bring 20-30 people to give ₹500cr cash to AAP: Sukesh to Kejriwal
144.article_body: Conman Sukesh Chandrashekhar, while addressing Delhi CM and AAP chief Arvind Kejriwal in a letter, accused the latter of receiving money in exchange for seats. "Kejriwal ji, why you forced me to bring 20-30 more individuals to contribute ₹500 crore cash to AAP in return for seats and postings in AAP Karnataka and Tamil Nadu in 2016?" He alleged.

145.title: Labourers fighting over water fall from Thane building's 2nd floor, 1 dead
145.article_body: Two labourers staying in a building in Thane's Bhiwandi got into a fight over who of the two would go to fetch water from the ground floor. Both of them fell from the second floor of the building, following which one of them died. The other one has been booked for culpable homicide not amounting to murder.

146.title: England reach T20 World Cup 2022 semi-finals after win vs SL; Australia knocked out
146.article_body: England advanced to semi-finals of T20 World Cup 2022 after defeating Sri Lanka by four wickets in their last Super 12 stage Group 1 match. England finished second on the points table with seven points and a superior net run-rate than Australia, who have been knocked out of the tournament. New Zealand qualified for semi-finals from Group 1 on Friday.

147.title: Regional parties in T'gana, Andhra are 'match fixing' parties: Jairam Ramesh
147.article_body: Congress leader Jairam Ramesh said that only Congress can fight with the BJP as all the regional parties in Telangana and Andhra Pradesh are "match fixing" parties. "[All the regional parties] have a good understanding with the BJP. All…are scared of ED, I-T and CBI," said Ramesh. He added that Congress' Bharat Jodo Yatra will act as a booster.

148.title: Himanshu Vyas joins BJP after resigning from Congress' primary membership
148.article_body: Former Congress leader Himanshu Vyas joined the Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) on Saturday, hours after resigning as the AICC Secretary Incharge of Indian Overseas Congress and from the party's primary membership. He joined the party at the Gujarat BJP office 'Shri Kamalam' and was welcomed by Union Home Minister Amit Shah and State Party President C R Paatil.

149.title: 57-yr-old BMC official caught while accepting ₹50 lakh bribe, booked
149.article_body: A 57-year-old executive engineer of the Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) was allegedly caught by Anti-Corruption Bureau while accepting ₹50 lakh bribe to stop action against a company for illegal construction in Andheri, an official said. The accused was posted at the BMC's K-east ward. A case has been registered under relevant provisions of the Prevention of Corruption Act.

150.title: Iranian footballer wears slogan against Iran's hijab rule in ISL match, sent off
150.article_body: Iranian footballer Vafa Hakhamaneshi was dismissed after getting his second yellow card during an Indian Super League (ISL) match in Bengal after he revealed his vest with slogans protesting Iran's mandatory hijab rule. Hakhamaneshi went toward the cameras after scoring his first goal in India and lifted his t-shirt to reveal the slogan "#women #life #freedom for 11:11".

151.title: Russia struggling to train newly mobilised troops: UK
151.article_body: UK's Defence Ministry said Russia is probably struggling to provide military training for its current mobilisation drive and annual autumn conscription intake. According to the ministry, newly mobilised conscripts likely have "minimal training or no training at all". "Experienced officers and trainers have been deployed to fight in Ukraine and some have likely been killed in...conflict," it added.

152.title: AIIMS Delhi to provide real-time info on beds from Dec 25
152.article_body: AIIMS Delhi will provide real-time status of beds in its general and private wards from December 25 through a 'Patient Care Dashboard' on its website, a memorandum by AIIMS Director Dr M Srinivas said. The website will also provide statistics regarding radiology tests. AIIMS Delhi has already launched a dashboard to show the availability of beds in its emergency department.

153.title: K-pop band NCT 127 ends concert after 30 fans faint in Indonesia
153.article_body: K-pop band NCT 127 was forced to end their first concert in Indonesia's Jakarta abruptly after 30 people fainted in a crush, police said. During the concert, the fans had started surging forward to get closer to the stage and because of this people fainted, the police added. NCT 127 member Taeyong has apologised for creating "bad memories".

154.title: Russia, China bent over backwards to justify North Korea's missile launches: US
154.article_body: US has accused Russia and China of "bending over backwards" to justify North Korea's ballistic missile launches. During a Security Council meeting on Friday, US also said that Russia and China provided "blanket protection" to Pyongyang from UN's actions. Representatives from Russia and China accused the US of escalating tensions by conducting joint military exercises with South Korea.

155.title: Punjab & Sind Bank's Q2 profit rises by 27% to ₹278 crore
155.article_body: Punjab & Sind Bank reported a 27% rise in its net profit to ₹278 crore in the July-September quarter as against ₹218 crore in the year-ago period. This was led by a reduction in bad loans. The lender's total income during the quarter surged to ₹2,120.17 crore. On Friday, the bank's stock closed 8.77% higher at ₹18.60 apiece on BSE.

156.title: BJP sticker seen on car used during IT raid on J'khand MLA, CM reacts
156.article_body: A video has surfaced purportedly showing a BJP sticker on a car in which Income Tax officials arrived to conduct raid at Jharkhand Congress MLA Kumar Jaimangal Singh's residence on Friday. The sticker was later removed by a man wearing a BJP stole. Chief Minister Hemant Soren said, "Where lies morality?...[BJP is] robbing the mandate of people using central agencies."

157.title: Iran acknowledges sending drones to Russia for the first time
157.article_body: Iranian Foreign Minister Hossein Amirabdollahian has acknowledged that Iran supplied drones to Russia, insisting that the transfer happened before the Russian invasion of Ukraine began. "We gave a limited number of drones to Russia months before the Ukraine war," Amirabdollahian said. Earlier this week, Iran's Ambassador to the UN said the allegations of sending drones were "totally unfounded".

158.title: T'gana CM KCR capable of acting in political field: BJP's NV Subhash
158.article_body: After Telangana CM KCR released a video to back poaching charges against the BJP, the Opposition party has called KCR an actor in the political field. BJP spokesperson NV Subhash called the allegations baseless and unwarranted. "KCR is capable of acting in [the] political field with his lies and dialogues and [can mesmerise] political workers with his lies," said Subhash.

159.title: Mumbai civic body starts resurfacing work on city's 18 roads
159.article_body: After taking verbal permission from the traffic police, the Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation has taken up the work to resurface 18 of the 449 bad roads in Mumbai. "These are small internal roads which need resurfacing as they developed potholes during monsoon," a BMC official said. Out of these 18 roads, 14 are located in the city's western suburbs.

160.title: Man kills his parents & 2 sons, dumps bodies then kills self in Raj
160.article_body: A 38-year-old man allegedly died by suicide after murdering his parents and two sons, aged eight and 14, police said. The accused apparently dumped the bodies in a water tank before jumping into another tank, an SHO said. The police suspect the man drugged his wife and other family members, who were also present in the house, the SHO added.

161.title: Pharma company adopts African lion at Hyd's Nehru Zoological Park
161.article_body: Manohar, an African Lion, at Hyderabad's Nehru Zoological Park has been adopted by Aurigene Pharmaceutical Services Limited for a period of one year. According to the zoo officials, representatives from the pharmaceutical company handed over a cheque of ₹1 lakh towards the adoption and maintenance charges of the lion. Last year, the company adopted a Royal Bengal tiger.

162.title: Tata Motors to hike prices of passenger vehicles by 0.9% from Nov 7
162.article_body: Tata Motors on Saturday announced a marginal price hike across its passenger vehicles from November 7. "Effective November 7, 2022, the weighted average increase will be 0.9%, depending on the variant and model," the company said in a statement. "The steep rise in overall input costs has compelled...to pass on some proportion through this minimal price hike," the automaker added.

163.title: UP CM directs Noida, Greater Noida authorities to hire more staff
163.article_body: Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath has directed senior officials of the Noida and Greater Noida authorities to recruit more staff for smooth functioning. Notably, the Noida and Greater Noida authorities are functioning with only 25% staff, officials said. "We requested the CM if he could allocate personnel from the state government...We are also hiring contractual staff," an official said.

164.title: North Korea fires 4 ballistic missiles as US & South Korea end drills
164.article_body: North Korea fired four short-range ballistic missiles into the western sea, South Korean military said. Saturday launches come as US and South Korea wrapped up the "Vigilant Storm" exercise they began on Monday. North Korea has launched a series of missiles this week, raising concerns that it could be preparing to resume nuclear testing for the first time since 2017.

165.title: PM Modi condoles the death of independent India's first voter
165.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Saturday expressed condolences over the death of 106-year-old Shyam Saran Negi who was independent India's first voter. "I bow my head in tribute to him with an emotional heart," he said. Adding that Negi had voted "over 30 times" in his life, the PM further said that this will inspire every citizen, especially the country's youth.

166.title: No communication from DoT since April: Vi on delay in equity conversion
166.article_body: When asked about the delay in the conversion of dues amounting to ₹16,130 crore into equity by the government, Vodafone Idea (Vi) CEO Akshaya Moondra said they are yet to hear from the Centre. "We have had no communication from the DoT since April when there was an agreement...don't know exactly the reason why this is not happening," Moondra said.

167.title: If I'm a 'thug' why did you get ₹50cr to offer RS seat to me?: Sukesh to Kejriwal
167.article_body: Jailed conman Sukesh Chandrashekhar addressed Delhi CM and AAP chief Arvind Kejriwal, in a letter on Saturday. "Kejriwal ji, if I'm the country's biggest 'thug' according to you, then on what basis you received ₹50 crore from me and offered Rajya Sabha (RS) seat to me?" asked Chandrashekhar. "What does that make you? 'Maha thug'?" he added.

168.title: Fire breaks out in 15-storey building in Thane; residents evacuated
168.article_body: A fire broke out in a 15-storey building in Thane's Thakurli after an electric meter box in the building reportedly caught fire on Saturday morning. The fire spread across the duct comprising electric wires and reached the top floor, covering the building in thick smoke, fire officials said. Fire, however, didn't enter flats and all the residents were evacuated safely.

169.title: 'Jana Gana Mana, Vande Mataram' have equal status: Centre to Delhi HC
169.article_body: The Centre informed the Delhi HC that "Jana Gana Mana" and "Vande Mataram" both stand on the same level and that every citizen should show equal respect to both. The Center's response was to a PIL that asked the government to frame guidelines for the National Song, giving it the same honour and status as the National Anthem.

170.title: Girl collapses, dies after teacher punishes students at B'luru school
170.article_body: A primary schoolgirl collapsed in her classroom on Friday while a teacher was allegedly punishing all the students of her class at a private school in Bengaluru. She was rushed to a hospital by teachers but was declared brought dead, police said. Later, the school authorities took the girl's body to her home. The child's father has lodged a complaint.

171.title: List party workers to be chosen in civic body: Thiruvananthapuram Mayor to CPI(M)
171.article_body: Thiruvananthapuram Corporation Mayor Arya Rajendran allegedly wrote a letter to district secretary Anavoor Nagappan, seeking the priority list of party cadres to be appointed in temporary posts in the civic body. According to reports, Nagappan has said that he had not seen such a letter and that he cannot confirm if the letter was fake.

172.title: SBI posts highest-ever quarterly net profit after 74% YoY rise in Q2
172.article_body: State Bank of India (SBI) on Saturday reported its highest-ever quarterly net profit of ₹13,264.62 crore, up nearly 74% year-over-year, for the July-September quarter. The country's largest state-run lender posted a 15% year-over-year increase in interest earned to ₹79,859.59 crore, while interest expended was ₹44,676.15 crore. At the end of Q2, SBI deposits stood at ₹41,90,254.88 crore.

173.title: They arrested my PA after not finding anything in ED raid: Delhi Dy CM Sisodia
