In August, Minister of State for Housing and Urban Affairs Kaushal Kishore had told Lok Sabha that November is the deadline to complete the project.

348.title: Govt authorities thwart child marriage attempt in Indore
348.article_body: The anti-child marriage flying squad thwarted a child marriage attempt by a family in the Dhabli village of Madhya Pradesh's Indore district. A 17-year-old girl was allegedly getting married to a 21-year-old man before the authorities rushed to the spot and warned the girl's family about the consequences of child marriage, an official said.

349.title: I spent a few years contemplating suicide: Selena Gomez
349.article_body: Singer Selena Gomez, in an interview with Rolling Stone, revealed that although she never attempted suicide, she spent a few years contemplating it. "I thought the world would be better if I wasn't there," she stated. Selena, who was diagnosed with bipolar disorder, stated, "Sometimes it was weeks I'd be in bed...even walking downstairs would get me out of breath."

350.title: Several areas in Bengaluru to witness power cuts this weekend
350.article_body: Bengaluru's electricity manager, the Bangalore Electricity Supply Company (BESCOM), has listed areas of the city which are set to face power cuts this weekend due to several reasons, including maintenance work. Areas like Malleshwaram, Dollars Colony, Nagashetty Halli and New BEL Road will face power cuts on Saturday, while areas like Peresandra and Chikkaballapura will have power cuts on Sunday.

351.title: Mohammad Nabi steps down as Afghanistan captain after T20 World Cup 2022 exit
351.article_body: Mohammad Nabi has stepped down as Afghanistan captain after his team's T20 World Cup 2022 campaign ended without a victory. "From the last one year...our...preparation wasn't to a level...a captain would want...or needed for a big tournament," he said. He further said he wasn't on the same page with team management and selection committee in some of the last tours.

352.title: 3,18,000 Russian military reservists mobilised: Vladimir Putin
352.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin on Friday said that Russia had mobilised 3,18,000 military reservists, news agency Interfax reported. Kremlin had earlier said the "partial mobilisation" ordered by Putin would see 3,00,000 reservists being called up to serve in Ukraine. Russia's Defence Minister Sergei Shoigu announced last Friday that the goal to mobilise the reservists had been achieved.

353.title: 132-year-old tunnel discovered at a hospital in Mumbai, pics surface
353.article_body: A tunnel built during the British era in India has been discovered at the JJ Hospital in Mumbai. The foundation stone of the 200-metre-long tunnel mentions the year 1890. An official said the building under which it has been discovered was once used as medical ward to treat women and children, and now it's being converted into a nursing college.

354.title: Congress will cancel Agnipath scheme when it comes to power: Priyanka
354.article_body: Congress General Secretary Priyanka Gandhi Vadra has stated that the party will cancel the Agnipath Army recruitment scheme when it comes to power at the Centre. "What we promise, we fulfil," she said, adding, "In Chhattisgarh, we promised farmer's loan waiver and it was implemented." She was addressing a gathering in Himachal Pradesh's Kangra ahead of the state Assembly elections.

355.title: Leopard attacks residents in Mysuru, later rescued by forest dept
355.article_body: A video showing a leopard attacking some residents in Karnataka's Mysuru has been shared by an Indian Forest Service officer online. As per reports, the victims escaped with minor to no injuries. The leopard was reportedly captured and rescued by forest department officials. "Its only mistake was that it was seen. After which people became wild," the forest officer tweeted.

356.title: Would file defamation suit: Karan on Rajeev's allegations about dating his wife
356.article_body: Karan Mehra opened up after Rajeev Sen accused his wife, Charu Asopa, of having an affair with him. Karan said he would rather file a defamation suit against Rajeev. "I had spoken to Charu...at a promotional event in June," he said. "Prior to the event...I...met Charu about 10 years ago," he added. "What romance is Rajeev talking about?" Karan questioned.

357.title: Pune Police arrest couple for illegal money lending
357.article_body: Pune City Police have arrested a couple for allegedly lending money illegally and threatening to kill a borrower. The accused are residents of Dhayari and were identified as Jairam Nivrutti Pokale, 43, and Hema Jairam Pokale, 36. The couple lent ₹6.75 lakh to the victim and even after they were repaid ₹9.45 lakh, the accused demanded more money.

358.title: SC to hear plea seeking intervention on Delhi's worsening air on Nov 10
358.article_body: The Supreme Court (SC) on Friday said on November 10 it will hear a plea seeking its "urgent intervention" to control the worsening air quality in Delhi. Advocate Shashank Shekhar Jha has filed the petition. Jha said Air Quality Index (AQI) has gone above 500 and that healthy people were also having breathing issues.

359.title: I'm going on 30-day verbal fast, no alcohol, no adult films or intercourse: Kanye West
359.article_body: Rapper Kanye West said that he will be taking a "verbal fast". Announcing a "30-day cleanse", Kanye tweeted, "I'm not talking to [nobody] for a month." "I'm taking a 30 day cleanse. A verbal fast. No alcohol. No adult films. No intercourse. In God we praise. Amen. But my Twitter still lit," his post read.

360.title: Pune civic body to extend door-to-door waste collection initiative
360.article_body: The Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) is planning to extend its door-to-door waste collection initiative at a cost of ₹5 crore for the first year of extension. "The agreement of PMC with Swachh Cooperative (organisation of waste pickers) is coming to an end and hence the civic administration has proposed to extend it by five years," said Municipal Commissioner Vikram Kumar.

361.title: Thane authority plans ₹100 crore city makeover in next 2.5 months
361.article_body: The Thane civic authority is planning to spend ₹100 crore to beautify the city with paintings and colourful illuminations in the next two and a half months. The authority will also focus on clearing construction debris and abandoned vehicles parked in the city. A 25-metre-tall 'pillar of lights' is being constructed on either side of the Anandnagar toll plaza.

362.title: Fridge explodes at Tamil Nadu home, 3 siblings suffocate to death
362.article_body: Three siblings died and two other persons were hospitalised due to asphyxiation after a refrigerator exploded at their residence in Tamil Nadu on Friday. Neighbours reportedly broke open the apartment's door. "We suspect there must have been a blast in the air compressor of the refrigerator caused either due to a short circuit or wire malfunctioning," a police officer said.

363.title: Shah Rukh Khan pushed his body to breaking point for 'Pathaan': Director
363.article_body: Director Siddharth Anand, speaking about Shah Rukh Khan's physical transformation for 'Pathaan', said that he "pushed his body to breaking point" for the action-thriller film. He added that the way Shah Rukh has endured all the pain to pull off the action is unbelievable. Siddharth further said the actor deserves all the love that he's getting for the film's teaser.

364.title: I was told 'whoever debuted with Salman didn't last long': Sonakshi
364.article_body: Actress Sonakshi Sinha, when asked about being told 'whoever debuted alongside Salman Khan didn't have a long-lasting career', said, "This (is) such a sad thing to a newcomer who's just about to start their life." "It was very random at that point of time...I concentrated on...work and that's the only way," she added. Sonakshi made her debut with Salman-starrer 'Dabangg'.

365.title: Ambition is fine, manner of approach is what matters: Gehlot
365.article_body: Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot, without naming anyone, said while it is reasonable to have ambition in politics, it is the approach that makes the difference. He further refused to comment on any alleged internal conflict within the party. The remark comes after former Deputy CM Sachin Pilot pushed the Congress to end the "state of indecision" over the CM post.

366.title: Twitter starts laying off employees in India, fires entire marketing department: Report
366.article_body: Twitter has started laying off employees in India as part of a global job cut ordered by the social media platform's new owner Elon Musk. Twitter has sacked the entire marketing department in India, as per a report. Musk took over the company in a $44-billion deal last week and fired CEO Parag Agrawal and other executives.

367.title: No one seems to care: Biocon chief on condition of B'luru's Hosur Road
367.article_body: Biocon's Executive Chairperson Kiran Mazumdar-Shaw on Friday said that no one seems to care about the condition of Bengaluru's Hosur Road. She tagged Road Transport and Highways Minister Nitin Gadkari and tweeted, "NHAI...isn't doing a great job of [maintaining] Hosur Road. The median is shoddy [and] no one seems to care." She further stated that Bengaluru needs world-class national highways.

368.title: IndiGo Q2 loss widens to ₹1,583.3 cr, revenue surges by 122.8%
368.article_body: InterGlobe Aviation, parent company of IndiGo, reported that net loss in the second quarter widened to ₹1,583.3 crore from ₹1,435.7 crore in the same quarter of previous fiscal. However, the aviation company's revenue from operations increased by 122.8% to ₹12,497.6 crore, compared with ₹5,608.49 crore from the year-ago period. IndiGo reported that passenger numbers jumped by 75.9% to 1.97 crore.

369.title: 3 arrested, contraband drugs worth ₹17 crore seized: Delhi Police
369.article_body: Three persons, including a Nigerian national, were arrested and contraband drugs worth ₹17 crore have been seized from them, said the Special Cell of Delhi Police. The police seized 241 gm of cocaine and 2 kg of heroin from the accused's possession. "The drugs used to be trafficked from Latin America to Africa to India via aerial routes," police said.

370.title: We are too obsessed with money as opposed to content: Abhishek Bachchan
370.article_body: Actor Abhishek Bachchan believes that the film industry has become "far too obsessed about collections and money as opposed to the content". Talking about OTT platforms, Bachchan said, "Fortunately, digital platforms do not put out numbers. It keeps the focus on content." He added, "Good content will always work no matter the medium."

371.title: 5 pigs test positive for African Swine Fever in MP's Katni
371.article_body: As many as five pigs tested positive for African Swine Fever in Madhya Pradesh's Katni, an official said. After the pigs tested positive, a prohibitory order was also issued in the district. "Two zones have been formed for the prevention of the disease. One is 'Infected zone'...and the other is 'Surveillance zone'," Deputy Director of Veterinary Department RK Singh said.

372.title: Bikaji Foods International's ₹881.2 cr IPO subscribed 1.48 times on day 2
372.article_body: Bikaji Foods International's ₹881.2-crore IPO was subscribed 1.48 times on the second day of bidding as it received bids for 3.04 crore equity shares against an offer size of 2.06 crore shares. The portion of the IPO reserved for retail investors was subscribed 2.33 times, whereas that of non-institutional investors was booked 1.42 times as of 6 pm on Friday.

373.title: Income Tax Dept raids residences of 2 Congress MLAs in Jharkhand
373.article_body: Around 30-35 officials of the Income Tax Department conducted raids at the residence of Congress MLA Kumar Jaimangal alias Anup Singh in Jharkhand's Dhori on Friday. Premises of Congress MLA Pradeep Yadav in the state were also searched. The searches were reportedly conducted over tax evasion charges. "The searches were carried out under the pressure of the BJP," Jaimangal alleged.

374.title: GHMC to contribute 5% more towards maintenance charges for parks
374.article_body: The Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation (GHMC) has decided to increase the maintenance charges by 5% that it pays for 730 colony parks and 34 tree parks from 2023. GHMC used to contribute 75% of the cost of maintaining colony parks, with welfare associations covering the remaining 25%. This will reportedly impose an additional burden of over ₹2.50 crore on GHMC.

375.title: Policemen may lose jobs if found intoxicated on duty: Assam DGP
375.article_body: Assam DGP Bhaskar Jyoti Mahanta has warned that policemen in the state may lose their jobs if found intoxicated during duty hours. New rules will be introduced to check the wrongdoings of policemen who don't work sincerely, he added. He stressed that police should be friendly with the public and shouldn't call people to the police station for petty matters.

376.title: Acting leader of Muslim Brotherhood dies at 85, group says
376.article_body: The acting leader of Egypt's banned Muslim Brotherhood, Ibrahim Munir, passed away on Friday, the Islamist organisation said on its website. Munir died in London at the age of 85. He had been living in exile for most of the last 40 years. The Muslim Brotherhood won Egypt's presidential elections in 2012 but was overthrown by the military in 2013.

377.title: 3 men pose as CBI officers, rob 4 men of ₹6.28 lakh in Mumbai
377.article_body: Mumbai Police are searching for three men who pretended to be CBI officers and robbed four men on their way to the airport to take a flight to Abu Dhabi on Tuesday. The victims were robbed of cash, goods and valuables worth ₹6.28 lakh. As per the complainant's statement, the accused started beating him and snatched his mobile phone.

378.title: Guinea's junta orders legal action against ex-Prez on graft charges
378.article_body: Guinea's military junta on Thursday ordered the initiation of legal action against former President Alpha Conde and over 180 officials from his deposed government for alleged corruption, according to a public document. Conde's government was overthrown last year. The junta's opponents have accused it of targeting Conde's old allies in order to prevent them from contesting the next elections.

379.title: Pune constable attacks woman shopkeeper over parking; suspended
379.article_body: Pune Police have suspended a constable for allegedly beating up a woman shopkeeper over a motorcycle parking issue. The constable had parked his motorcycle outside the woman's shop. When she objected to it, saying it would cause inconvenience for her customers, he started abusing her and assaulted her later. The woman has sustained serious injuries to her right eye.

380.title: Go to Pakistan, don't create it in Bihar: BJP to CM Nitish Kumar
380.article_body: The BJP has criticised Bihar CM Nitish Kumar for his intentions to restore Urdu in schools and accused him of "creating Pakistan" in the state. "In the Muslim-dominated districts...lives of Dalits, OBCs and EBCs get ruined...go to Pakistan yourself," said the Bihar BJP. Kumar had earlier claimed that the Centre was doing little work apart from propaganda for poor states.

381.title: 25-year-old Indian man's post after getting fired from Twitter goes viral
381.article_body: Elon Musk-owned Twitter has started firing employees. A 25-year old Indian man named Yash Agarwal, who got sacked, shared a smiling picture and tweeted, "Just got laid off. Bird App, it was an absolute honour, the greatest privilege ever to be a part of this team...#LoveWhereYouWorked #LoveTwitter." He worked as a Public Policy Associate for Twitter India and South Asia.

382.title: 'Terrorists to arrive in Haji Ali', hoax caller tells Mumbai Police; apprehended
382.article_body: A 36-year-old mentally unstable man was apprehended for making a hoax call to the control room of the Mumbai Police. "The caller...said that terrorists are going to come in Haji Ali...after which a search was done...but we did not find anything suspicious." police said. The police interrogated the man but no FIR was registered and he was sent home.

383.title: She doesn't like violence, prefers to go to Parliament: Abhishek on mom Jaya
383.article_body: Actor Abhishek Bachchan has said his mother, veteran actress Jaya Bachchan, has refused to watch his show 'Breathe: Into the Shadows' as she doesn't like "that kind of aggression and violence". "So she prefers to go to Parliament where none of that happens," he added. Abhishek further said his father Amitabh Bachchan "binge-watched the series".

384.title: 'Pakistan Zindabad' slogans raised at BSP rally in UP; video emerges
384.article_body: A video purportedly showing people raising 'Pakistan Zindabad' slogans during a Bahujan Samaj Party (BSP) rally in Uttar Pradesh's Azamgarh has surfaced on social media. The rally was organised to campaign for local body elections in Jahanaganj area. Police on Friday detained BSP election candidate Pappu Khan and one of his supporters named Khursheed Ahmed in connection with the case.

385.title: We're aiming to remove range anxiety in EV riders: Taiwan's Gogoro
385.article_body: Taiwan-based Gogoro has partnered with Gurugram-based Zypp Electric, an EV-as-a-Service providing platform, to launch a battery-swapping pilot in India. The companies will launch the B2B program in December in New Delhi with 100 electric scooters. "We're aiming to remove range anxiety in riders. Through our technology, one can go up to 100 kms on every swap," said CEO of Gogoro.

386.title: Less than 1/3rd of Mumbai's bridges in good condition: BMC audit
386.article_body: As per an ongoing audit by the Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC), less than one-third of the bridges in the city are in sound condition. Of the 340 bridges audited, 54 are in dilapidated condition and need reconstruction. "Audit is an ongoing process and recommendation in the report is not the final word," said Sanjay Kaundanyapure, chief of the bridges department.

387.title: Australia defeat Afghanistan by 4 runs, go 2nd on T20 WC 2022 Super 12 points table
387.article_body: Australia defeated Afghanistan by four runs in their T20 World Cup 2022 Super 12 stage match on Friday. With the victory, Australia jumped to the second place on the Group 1 points table with seven points. Australia will qualify for the semi-finals if England lose to Sri Lanka. New Zealand have already qualified for the semi-finals from the group.

388.title: Was told Judaai would fail, audience won't accept Sridevi as Anil's wife: Boney
388.article_body: Boney Kapoor revealed that people predicted that 1997 film 'Judaai' featuring Anil Kapoor and Sridevi would flop. "Everybody said...Judaai will bomb at...box office...They said how will people digest the fact...[Sridevi] is married to me, but on screen, she plays Anil's (Kapoor, his brother) wife," he added. 'Judaai', which was reportedly made on a budget of ₹6.3 crore, collected ₹28.77 crore.

389.title: Garmin appoints Yeshudas Pillai as new Country Head for India
389.article_body: US-based wearable brand Garmin's Indian unit has announced the appointment of Yeshudas Pillai as the new Country Head for its operations. In this role, he will be driving stakeholder engagement, growth, and development of the brand in India, according to a statement by Garmin. Garmin aims to add seven new brand stores in the country by 2023.

390.title: Former Meta India head Ajit Mohan joins Snap as Asia Pacific President
390.article_body: Meta's former India head Ajit Mohan is joining Snapchat parent Snap as its President for the Asia Pacific (APAC) region, the company's CEO Evan Spiegel said. "Ajit will provide in-market leadership, lead cross-functional efforts across the region, oversee local operations, and lead our go-to-market strategy," Spiegel said. Meta on Thursday announced that Mohan has resigned after nearly four years.

391.title: Vietnam to remove 'false' content from social media in 24 hours
391.article_body: Vietnam’s Minister of Information and Communications Nguyen Manh Hung has said that "false" content on social media must be taken down within 24 hours, instead of 48 hours previously. Hung told the Parliament that false news spreads widely if handled slowly. He added that penalties in Vietnam for spreading misinformation are one-tenth of level imposed by other Southeast Asian nations.

392.title: Tesla's ex-India policy head Manuj Khurana to join Ather Energy: Report
392.article_body: Tesla's former India Policy and Business Development Chief Manuj Khurana is reportedly joining electric scooter startup Ather Energy. Khurana joined Tesla in March 2021 and quit the US electric automaker in June. He will join Ather as a vice president. Ather raised $128 million from investors, including Hero MotoCorp and the National Investment & Infrastructure Fund this year.

393.title: 57 out of 100 wards reserved in Ghaziabad for civic polls
393.article_body: The Ghaziabad Municipal Corporation has finalised the list of reserved wards for the upcoming municipal elections and sent it for approval. As many as 57 wards out of the total 100 have been reserved, with 14 wards being reserved for the SC category, 21 for the OBC category and 22 for women candidates, Municipal Commissioner Nitin Gaur said on Thursday.

394.title: India calls for more clarity on definition of climate finance
394.article_body: The Ministry of Environment, Forest and Climate Change said more clarity is needed on definition of climate finance for developing countries to assess the extent required for climate action. Ahead of the COP27 climate summit, the ministry added, "The goal of $100 billion/year of climate finance by 2020 and every year thereafter through till 2025 is yet to be achieved."

395.title: Video shows Shiv Sena leader Sudhir Suri bleeding after being shot in Amritsar
395.article_body: A video shows Shiv Sena leader Sudhir Suri bleeding on the ground after being shot at in Punjab's Amritsar. Some people can be seen rushing to help him. The Shiv Sena leader, who reportedly sustained two bullet injuries, passed away, said a police official. The accused has been arrested, police added.

396.title: Russia likely shooting its own retreating soldiers: UK
396.article_body: The UK's Defence Ministry said that Russian forces have probably started deploying "barrier troops" or "blocking units" that "threaten to shoot their own retreating soldiers" fighting in Ukraine. "These units have been used in previous conflicts by Russian forces," it added. "The tactic of shooting deserters likely attests to the...low morale and indiscipline of Russian forces," it further said.

397.title: Farmers are backbone of rising India: Vice President Dhankhar
397.article_body: Vice President Jagdeep Dhankhar said that farmers are the backbone of a rising India and also credited industry for driving the agriculture sector on a new trajectory. "Bharat is on the rise [like] never before. It [has] a global recognition…It is the [farmers] who need to be well informed so that [they] adopt economically sustainable measures," said Dhankhar.

398.title: AAP failing to curb air pollution in Delhi: Piyush Goyal
398.article_body: Union Minister Piyush Goyal criticised AAP for air pollution in Delhi and said that people would vote against them. "Despite their big assurances, the state [Delhi] government is failing at all fronts, whether it is air pollution levels, keeping a check on corruption, improving infrastructure, or fulfilling its promises. Delhi residents are...fed up with their hollow promises," said Goyal.

399.title: Umpiring blunder leads to 5-ball over during Australia's innings against Afghanistan
399.article_body: An umpiring blunder led to a five-ball over during Australia's innings against Afghanistan in T20 World Cup 2022. A delivery in the over was mistakenly counted twice on broadcast graphic after David Warner and Mitchell Marsh ran overthrow. Umpires then called 'over' after just five balls were bowled. The score was later corrected, but Australia's innings remained a ball short.

400.title: US-based company Opendoor to lay off nearly 550 employees
400.article_body: US-based property-selling firm Opendoor will lay off about 550 employees, the company's Chief Executive Officer Eric Wu said. "We're navigating one of the most challenging real estate markets in 40 years and need to adjust our business," Wu said. He added that the company earlier scaled back its capacity by over 830 positions, primarily by reducing third-party resourcing.
